mdRecord.dcterms:title: Spike & Spine from Pickelhaube
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The M1895 (M1896 for Bavarian model) Pickelhaube was used when the war broke out. It was a black lacquered leather helmet with a heavily rounded front visor and a less rounded rear visor. The rear spine was equipped with an air vent fitted with a small sliding cover. The spine had 5 ventilation holes in the base. Here only the spike, without the base, was found.
